website_summaries.verdict: Many caregivers and users prefer the slide action of this bench to the rigid design of other models. We appreciate the emphasis on safety during use.
pros: Nylon seat strap for additional security
cons: Total weight capacity might be overstated
Plastic parts prone to breakage.Center seat cut-out poorly designed

customer_reviews.title: Broken brackets
customer_reviews.text: Really liked this seat as it slid and also had a hole in the seat that was so helpful for us. My mom only weighs 95 lbs but all four brackets on the bottom have broken. At this point it can't be used for safety issues. Hoping to hear from the manufacturer or seller to see if we can get new brackets to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Karen C.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly. I wish it were a little wider. My husband uses a lift to get onto the seat and I have to push him sideways because 1/4 of the seat is already in tub. If it was like 4 inches wider would be easier to use to position him. Once he is in the seat he lives it.
customer_reviews.author: budswifedml

customer_reviews.title: Prepare to get in to the shower to secure chair for your clients. 👎🏽
customer_reviews.text: This design is ridiculous. First the cut out center sticks to the persons bottom falling into the tub when you stand the individual, second the way this chairs clamps on the sides require you to crawl into the shower with the individual to secure clamp down and back in to unsecured to pull seated individual out. Absolutely the worst chair I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Myanna Ady

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for anyone with limited mobility or balance
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for anyone with mobility problems, Wish I had this long ago. Sit person on seat outside the tub, put one leg in, side seat to center, lift other leg in , slide seat into tub to lock in place. WOW no more lifting and balancing. This is a Gift to both of us.
customer_reviews.author: gerodd

customer_reviews.title: Bracket broke after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I’m really surprised by all of the high reviews on this transfer bench. It’s just not a great product. The bracket that connects the seat to the bar broke after 3 months. (Picture attached) The person using the chair is under 300lbs, so that isn’t the issue. In addition to that, the seat isn’t very big or comfortable and the releases for the slider are awkward to reach. I can’t imagine how this would work for someone who is even close to 400lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Living with MS

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this less than one year ago. First the rubber tips to keep the chair from sliding on the shower surface, all fell off and even though we would reinstall them, they would not stay on. Then both of the back plastic pieces that let the chair transfer and keep the chair in place broke, so the chair is unsafe nor will is lock in place! My husbands caregivers said it was not safe!
customer_reviews.author: shirleyt

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: This operates very easily and allows you to slide across from the outside the tub to the inside of the tub. The obvious downfall is that 1/2 of the piece of equipment sits outside of the tub and does not look very nice, that's the least of anyone's problem when it makes your life so simple. The downfall to this is the obvious as well which is that the shower curtain does not keep all of the water inside the shower if your using it as a shower because your shower liner is obstructed by this piece of equipment. But this thing does do the job very well.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe!
customer_reviews.text: My 83 year old mother who is recovering from surgery used this chair 3x a week for 2 months. She weighs 104lbs and after two months the chair cracked and my mother fell to the ground. Do not buy!! Faulty product!
customer_reviews.author: Jennean

customer_reviews.title: Empowered my spouse to shower again rather than rely on sponge baths.
customer_reviews.text: Seated with the bench just over the tub wall, swing legs over the wall then slide the bench in. My spouse slumps on the seat, and once in the tub, I step in and pull upright from behind then re-apply the seat strap. I considered lubricating the slide but did not, and it works well. We started by covering the seat and back with towels for comfort, but dropped that precaution after the first shower. For our tub, it was good that we purchased a shower wand with 80" hose. We are happy, and if time lessens functionality, we'll buy a new bench like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip R. Beaver

customer_reviews.title: Brackets holding chair to frame not sturdy enough.
customer_reviews.text: After 15 months of careful use by a 160 pound man the plastic brackets holding the chair to the frame split and made the product unusable. At the very least we should be able to get replacement brackets, even if we have to pay for them. Very disappointed I can't even find a website to request replacement parts and so this has to go into the landfill!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: After a month,  it fell apart!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! It worked for about a month and then it busted apart! The slide feature was ideal for getting an elderly person in and out of a tub shower, but it wasn't worth it in the end. Returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Safety First!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for moving my disabled elderly parents in and out of shower! Easy to assemble and adjust legs accordingly for various heights of bath/shower floor to room floor, providing level seating. Makes showering much safer! Seat has lift out portion for accessible body washing without having to move person bathing. Seat however is hard durable plastic; this would be better if it were softer and easier on people with various health issues. Priced reasonably over competitors products. Overall, good product and I would recommend purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Replace plastic gliding parts
customer_reviews.text: My elderly mother. She weighs around 120. It is a easy chair and would give it five stars but for the plastic parts that break. And no answer where to order the parts that broke. So just 2 stars
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Comstore Card

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Makes my mom bath routine much easier. The small lever at the bottom of the seat could be placed in the back to make it a bit easier for the caregiver and allow some dignity if you will for the person in need. Otherwise, it is great for allowing those with mobility problems to bath safely. I would certainly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa M.

customer_reviews.title: This allows my cleint with a shower stahl.....
customer_reviews.text: to actually get a shower. I work with someone that has lost her ability to walk due to dementia. We were unable to give her a shower until she purchased this. We put half of it out of her shower, transfer her onto the sliding seat with her Hoyer lift and 'viola we slide her into the shower. Items like these are priceless because they enrich the quality of life, thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Shanna

customer_reviews.title: This is a good quality shower bench
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Duro-Med Heavy Duty Sliding Transfer Shower Bench for my father who needs it after his recent head injury since he's unable to stand. It can be difficult to get him in the shower and the sliding bench makes it so much easier. This is a good quality shower bench, sturdy and doesn't feel wobbly. The chair locks into place after sliding him over into the bathtub, and the cut-out makes it easy to clean him underneath. When we're done we just store it in the bathtub. we're very happy with this purchase - thank-you!
customer_reviews.author: K.B.

customer_reviews.title: Defective parts
customer_reviews.text: This transfer bench came with a leg that was defective! All the pieces have to be round to fit into each other to build it. One end was oval! I needed this bench, my mother has 2 fractured vertebrae & needed to bathe. I really think I was sent a previously returned defective product. I will not buy from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: patricia a.

customer_reviews.title: The chair is very helpful for people having difficulty getting in the bathtub/shower
customer_reviews.text: I have limited mobility. Getting in the bathtub to shower is very difficult. This shower chair works for me. It gives me peace of mind I recommend it to anybody who needs help getting in to bathe. The seat slides over the bathtub. I am so glad I found this chair. The only thing I don’t like is the clips that I have to grab to be able to slide the seat over the bathtub are small and plastic. Small Plastic don’t work well with continuous use. I am hoping that the plastic clips will hold. Other than that it is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Paver

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: The chair is very well designed and very smooth sliding from end to end. Not sure if we need the seatbelt, but we let it just hand under the chair. Easy assembly and very light makes moving it in and out of the tub easy. My suggestion: Use medical gloves when assembling because the seat rails have some sort of lubricant on them. Be careful
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I got this for after a knee replacement. Very Sturdy. I like how the seat comes apart so everything can get washed. My husband took the shower doors off. They were replaced, temporarily by a cheap spring rod and curtain. I cut slits in the shower curtain so the water drained inside of the tub. Very handy as a chair to sit on when getting dressed/undressed.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Barkay

customer_reviews.title: so it gets wet even though we are not using it and I'm afraid that it will start to rot out in short order and (2) the latch on
customer_reviews.text: It does the job. Two small things I would change: (1) the seat belt is not removable, so it gets wet even though we are not using it and I'm afraid that it will start to rot out in short order and (2) the latch on each end is good and secure but it is a bit of a hassle to release, especially when someone is sitting in the seat that can't unlatch it themselves. One thing I really like is the removable hole cover. It makes cleaning private parts much easier - and it doubles as a toilet seat saving a transfer to the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my grandma as a replacement to her old sliding bench that was over used and falling apart. It was easy to assemble out of the box, and there are a lot of customizable heights. Works great. The plastic joints will eventually wear down though, just like our old sliding bench, so I wish that could be made with a different type of material. But for now, it works. The strap is handy, but I wish it was detachable (or easily detachable?) to clean after use.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: I chose this because it was the right width to fit in our tub, which is located close to the toilet fixture. It is very sturdy and slides readily with someone seated on it. Assembly was fairly easy -- except for sliding the rubber feet onto the ends of the aluminum tube legs...I had to somewhat bevel the legs in order to get the rubber tips to slide onto the ends.
customer_reviews.author: Wilton

customer_reviews.title: great shower chair
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this shower chair for my daughter. It has been such a tremendous help. She is able to transfer out of her chair on to the shower chair without me having to lift her. The fact that it slides into the shower is awesome. My husband installed a shower sprayer bracket lower so the water is on her back and not pouring from up high onto her head. This makes shower time an enjoyable experience for both of us because I do not have to try and hold the sprayer and wash her hair at the same time Much easier than a standard shower chair!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Almost one year in and still good!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my disabled husband. He had a stroke so his balance is off. This chair is sturdy (my husband is a big fella) and now he can shower by himself. He does complain about his um jewels sometimes when he sits on it to slide in as he has to sit on the corner first (our shower is weird) but once he slides in and sits facing forward it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: dotpsc

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this product and would purchase it again
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great help to me getting into my shower from my wheelchair! This is very easy assembly and I love that it has the locking system so I am very secure. At first the sliding was a little tuff but gets better with use. This has been a great help for my Aide to get me transferred, it makes it much easier on her back and lessens the risk of falling like before.
customer_reviews.author: Jewels47

customer_reviews.title: So easy to put together my 80 mom did it
customer_reviews.text: This is a breeze to put together. It is sturdy and better than the ones provided by Medicare. My father is 6'4. The woman that is sent over to bath him was very impressed with this one. My father is dying from ESLD and every item (to include this walker) I have purchased from Amazon has been spot on. Better than the equipment/items medicare ended up sending.
customer_reviews.author: Red Riding Hood

customer_reviews.title: Great shower chair!
customer_reviews.text: Only received this item on 8th January but so far I’m very happy with it, I hummed and hahhed about buying it for a long time and eventually bought a different shower chair which broke within just a few months, so I bought this!, I really thought I would have trouble with the sliding seat however it works really well....so far! Should have bought this shower chair in the first place!
customer_reviews.author: Sophia I. Schultheis

customer_reviews.title: Seems well made but needs to be longer
customer_reviews.text: We will keep it and use it, but if it was 6-8 inches longer (minimum) then it would be much more useful. The patient needs to have full access to the seat outside of the shower and then be able to slide in completely. This is not the case with this model. We have a standard shower that is stock size and shape.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: PROBLEM SOLVED!
customer_reviews.text: For those who mentioned about problems with coverage of a shower curtain. Simply BUY a cheap second shower curtain and rings. Overlap 1 or 2 spaces on original curtain with the seam pointing away from the showerhead. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly, very sturdy (critical), and works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Wife recently diagnosed with MS. Doctor recommended she use one of these. I looked at all the options and selected this one. Easy assembly, very sturdy (critical), and works as advertised. She was hesitant at first but has become very comfortable using the bench.
customer_reviews.author: D4mitchTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great device that will improve your quality of life.
customer_reviews.text: My disabled wife had opted for baths administered with a wet washcloth while sitting on the commode. Then we purchased this excellent device. Now she can get into the shower and viva la difference. She weighs nearly 300 and suffers from a condition that necessitates her being on a course of pain meds. The Transfer Bench is a lifesaver. It was very easy to put together without tools. Actually, idiot proof. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Moishe Yidbaum

customer_reviews.title: Very useful for bathing
customer_reviews.text: This is the best, most useful piece of medical equipment I've purchased for my elderly mom. I use it for getting her in and out of the bathtub, which she can no longer step over. It's very well-made, and you can adjust the height of both sides. My bathtub is higher than the floor outside, so I adjusted one end to be lower than the other. I slide her in and then use a shower nozzle. It's so easy.
customer_reviews.author: P.A.

customer_reviews.title: This can help in maintaining independance or for ease of transfer in bath area can be used in an ALF as well .
customer_reviews.text: this chair is excellent for Safe transfers from outside of the bathtub to inside with minimal assistance . Im a C.N.A , and needed a safe way for my father who has hip and back problems with limited mobility to get in and out for showers . I highly recommend this product for any caregiver in a home or ALF setting . the seat also has a removable center for over the commode or peri care in shower.
customer_reviews.author: LadyT

customer_reviews.title: Wife Slider
customer_reviews.text: Terrific product? My wife had major back surgery and was unable to stand or walk without Assistance. She is able to use her Walker to walk up, be seated and slide into the bath tub. The assembly is easy, no tools needed. My wife loves it.
customer_reviews.author: flyway

customer_reviews.title: Using “shower chair” adds stability while showering.
customer_reviews.text: The shower chair is great idea if using bath tub is not an option. Chair seat actually slides side-to-side allowing the user full range of shower. Chair legs connect to base at an angle. This must be for safety but is disadvantage for closing shower door. (Small shower).
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Adams

customer_reviews.title: Finally found one
customer_reviews.text: After way to many hours researching benches this one did the job. I was worried about it being unstable when he go on it but it was super stable. I put it together in 10 mins so it was super simply. He uses it to transfer from his wheelchair to this bench. So glad I found it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Readence

customer_reviews.title: We bought this on 11/24/17. I have MS and ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this on 11/24/17. I have MS and I need this to shower. we have only had for about 5 months. The legs have bent/buckled and it is no longer safe to use. Too late to return it. I just don't want it to happen to someone else. Choose wisely!
customer_reviews.author: culton

customer_reviews.title: many issues
customer_reviews.text: It does not lock or unlock easily making it unsafe at times. Bolts holding the seat on fell out and could not find one to replace it making the seat wobble and not safe either. if you need this type of device spend a few dollars more to get a quality seat. this did not last 2 years for me.
customer_reviews.author: James H. Entrekin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for someone with limited Mobility
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to assemble. The legs adjust well and it fit our tub perfectly. It was extremely easy for my mother to sit on the chair and be slid across for a shower. The entire chair slid into the bathtub. My advice would be to make a cut out on a shower curtain to avoid water on the bathroom floor but nothing that at all can't wipe up easily and quickly. Very impressed by this product.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Utsch

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: It took us a while to get it assembled correctly but that have been more a case of not reading the directions correctly! Once assembled it was great. Saw me through the early stages following total hip replacement surgery. Certainly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: anne4491

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Those Who Are Unable To Walk Much
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for the elderly as it has a pop out center which makes it so much easier for personal bathing. The bench slides in and out which makes it perfect for those like my Mom who are in a wheelchair and are unable to walk much. Durable.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta  Natowitz

customer_reviews.title: Don’t know what I’d do without it!
customer_reviews.text: My grandmother is very sick and I’m her primary care giver. She’s staying at my house which only has bathtubs. I honestly wouldn’t be able to bathe her without this bench. It works perfectly and slide effortlessly. My only complaint is that it’s big and can’t be folded for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and use.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband who was recovering from heart surgery and is also disabled. The fact that he could get on outside the tub and then slide in was very helpful. Just after the surgery he needed help to slide across due to not being able to push or pull because of the surgery, but once he was cleared to do a little exertion he was able to push himself back and forth by himself.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Antuna

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Not only does this sliding shower bench work perfectly it works perfectly for my application. It's sturdy, comfortable, light weight, easy and smooth to operate, and not a eye sore in the bathroom. My 95 year old mother in law uses it and she feels comfortable on it and feels safe, and that's saying something. In our home it serves two people my mother in law and me and we both love it. I have a rare muscle disorder and can't step over the bath tub, I weigh well over 200lbs and the bench is very sturdy and solid underneath me. Would definitely buy again if need be.
customer_reviews.author: David moore

customer_reviews.title: Not good for standard tub’s.
customer_reviews.text: Not good for standard tub’s. This product would not slide my mom into the tub. It would stop before she was fully in and could not be extended Any further. If It would have to extend about another 10 inches to fit my tub. Returned
customer_reviews.author: MrWms

customer_reviews.title: Great for elderly and surgery recovery
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy transfer into and out of tub without fear of slipping. Note that it is very wide so if you have a very small bathroom it might get in way. It is very light (but sturdy) so easy to move around.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Lomelino

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: WORKS PERFECTLY! My father is 95 years old and we needed something that could safely get him into a shower stall (no tub). He uses his walker when transferring anywhere and stepping over the lip of the shower was dangerous. Now, he sits outside the shower and I can easily slide him in for his bath. BTW, he weighs 175 lbs. and there has been NO issue with the sliding mechanism of this chair!
customer_reviews.author: GirlOfPeace

customer_reviews.title: good equipment
customer_reviews.text: excellent. works easily but takes a bit of strength to 'latch' it so it doesn't move. He is easy to wrap a shower curtain around so the floor doesn't get wet. It's sturdy so the person feels secure. As long as there is another person around to help getting on/off, it's very good.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a prayer that was truly answered.
customer_reviews.text: This product is “heaven sent”. Recently my mother has been having balance issues. The doctor told me and my sister that mom can’t be left alone in the tub anymore. The transfer bench has been a life save for my mom and my sister. Mom just sits on the side of the bench that is outside the tub and the chair attached to the bench just slides over into the tub. There is no lifting on my mom and she gets to enjoy her bath. Thank you so much. This is truly an answered prayer.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Adjustability and functionality.
customer_reviews.text: Seat sliding feature is marginal. Again, thanks to China for manufacturing this item at a reasonable cost. I guess three rotational molded parts added to the overall cost.
customer_reviews.author: What a wonderful life.

customer_reviews.title: Great bench!
customer_reviews.text: Best bench for my Mom. She weighs about 375 and this was very sturdy for her. She slides right across with no issues. As far as the feet. It’s hard to turn them to get them the right angle to suction correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Cato Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Good bath aid
customer_reviews.text: This works great for someone who has the ability to walk and transfer with assistance. We especially like the removable insert in the seat to allow proper cleaning of those areas of the body.
customer_reviews.author: Bayoumom

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Elderly Mum can stay at home now without risk of falling. She had reached the point where bathing was dangerous. The chair is very solid. I am assembly challenged but did great with this chair. The chair slides easily and there is no need for a special shower curtain as water stays in the tub. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: solid four
customer_reviews.text: Good transfer bench recommended by a physical therapist for my 91 year old father. It works well but some people may still need assistance sliding the seat over. It does not slide with much ease it is plastic on metal. It's a good solution for tubs that are difficult to get in and out of.
customer_reviews.author: MSix2

customer_reviews.title: ... to use a tub to shower this is a great bench- you can cut the shower liner to go ...
customer_reviews.text: This item is not covered by Medicare so if you have someone with a broken hip that needs to use a tub to shower this is a great bench- you can cut the shower liner to go around it to keep the water from making a mess.
customer_reviews.author: KV

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and safe and easily assembled.
customer_reviews.text: In the early period, with a new knee, this sturdy transfer bench was an enormous help. Since I finished using it, I have been lending it to similarly afflicted friends. All have been grateful. Easy to assemble and adjust to our bathtub.
customer_reviews.author: Candelaria

customer_reviews.title: BEST SHOWER CHAIR
customer_reviews.text: This chair assembles quickly by an unskilled person. It helps a disabled person (with assistance) to get into and out of the shower without having to step over anything. Having the hole in the seat is great for thorough cleaning. You will get more water on the floor outside the shower, but mopping up a little water is better than picking up a person who slipped while transferring inside the shower.
customer_reviews.author: RUTH H.

customer_reviews.title: UNSAFE
customer_reviews.text: The four clamps that attach the chair to the rails cracked after less than two months. The chair is rated at 400 lbs and my mother weighs 150 lbs. This unit was not abused in any way
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: My elderly mother lives with me. She suffers from Alzheimer's and has difficulty with her knee joints. It was getting really difficult getting her in the tub/shower downstairs. This chair has made life much easier. She sits on the chair, and we slide her in to the bathtub/shower. I would definitely recommend this chair for those with disabilities that require assistance. I am thankful I made this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Mandarich

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and shower with ease
customer_reviews.text: My father had designed this bathroom around his age when he remodeled his house 6 years ago. With the 2 shower heads and controls he can easily slide back and forth for water and shower switch controls. The marble seat he had installed in the corner was too far away for convenience. When he had his stroke in July I had to make a few quick upgrades to make showering easier.
customer_reviews.author: Aileen

customer_reviews.title: NICE BENCH BUT HAD TO RETURN IT
customer_reviews.text: Had to return this bench. There was nothing wrong with it but my sister-in-law, whom it was purchased for, refused to try it so we returned it. I do believe it would have been a good bath bench if she would have tried it.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: I'm actually a bit over the weight rating, but I find this a very sturdy and easy to use slide chair. The legs adjust to compensate for the height difference in the floor and the floor of the tub. Easy to sanitize, very strong, but light and easy to move out of the way to allow others to use the shower normally. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Weber

customer_reviews.title: Great item.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use in the shower with a broken leg. Couldn't put weight on the leg so it was easy to sit on the seat and slide over the step in to the shower
customer_reviews.author: M Mc

customer_reviews.title: plastic parts holding chair on cracked making chair unsafe
customer_reviews.text: After using only once a week since September 2017 the plastic parts that hold the screws in under the sliding chair have cracked making the chair unsafe for patient. Patient weighs 180 lbs. Don't seem to be able to get a refund or replacement parts.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda M.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We had purchased a plastic shower chair that had plastic legs which was extremely wobbly. This chair is solid with good metal legs and no wobble.
customer_reviews.author: maruski

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This chair works great. It slides easily so I can sit on it and slide into the shower. I highly recommend it. It also handles a lot of weight.
customer_reviews.author: P. Roeder

customer_reviews.title: bed rail
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quick, easy set up, sturdy. Gives my mom extra stability getting out of and into bed, she was hesitant at first, loved it after the first night.
customer_reviews.author: Thman

customer_reviews.title: Sliding shower chair works great.
customer_reviews.text: I can transfer to and from my mobility scooter easily. Looking to take it when we travel since it can be taken apart and put back together.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Dalton

customer_reviews.title: a little difficult
customer_reviews.text: When you have a person with limited mobility its difficult working this chair.... I would sit the patient down with this and then try to push the seat over to the other side into the bathtub and due to legs could not get them over the bath tub. I went back to just the regular seated shower chair...
customer_reviews.author: pemster

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for o e thing use for another
customer_reviews.text: It did not work for my tub shower so now I use it for my husband to sit on to get dressed and to put shoes on. Itmis safer than him sitting on the bed so it was not a complete waste of money for me
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: Mom loves this chair....she is paralyzed on one side and has been scooching across a bench into the shower for years....this sliding chair make like so much easier for her...it is very lightweight and easy to move, but at the same time it is a high quality chair, not flimsy and it can handle 350 pounds easy.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mehalick

customer_reviews.title: We tried a loaner and liked it.
customer_reviews.text: We learned about the bench from a visiting nurse physical therapist and used a loaner one until we bought our own. It is a solution for helping to get a wheelchair bound patient into a shower. We have used the loaner or our own for about four months. It is not too comfortable with the lid off since it is a narrow flat surface, but works.
customer_reviews.author: Del

product_meta.title: Tub Transfer Bench and Sliding Shower Chair Made of Heavy Duty Non Slip Aluminum Body and Seat with Adjustable Seat Height and Cut Out Access Holding Weight Capacity up to 400 lbs, Gray
product_meta.description: Color:Tub Transfer Bench and Sliding Shower ChairThis best-selling sliding transfer bench will provide welcomed relief and increased independence for those who have trouble getting in and out of the shower, standing for prolonged periods or worries about falling while bathing. Using this bench is simple - Position one end of the bench outside the shower or bath and the other end inside, making sure the legs are level, locked and stable. Sit on the seat and easily slide across into the shower or bath. The backrest, which can be positioned for left or right-hand use, provides additional support and comfort along with a seat belt for safety. This transfer bench measures 39 inches across to allow ample room for the seat to slide. Be sure to measure your bathroom or shower area to make sure it will properly fit inside. Its total height can reach 37 inches when the legs are fully extended. The legs are adjustable in 12 inch increments, allowing you to change the seat height from 19 to 23 inches. It weighs just 14.5 pounds yet is heavy duty enough to support 400 pounds.
feature_bullets: Shower With Ease; This best selling tub and sliding shower bench makes transfers from wheelchairs or walkers to the bath or shower so much easier with its safe sliding design, minimizing physical strain on the user and caregiver.  Ideal bath tub seat for elderly seniors, disabled, handicapped or post surgical

Tool Free Design: Easy Install Assembly With Detailed Instructions. Free Standing Tub Shower Transfer Bench Does Not Require Any Permanent Mounting Hardware. Seat Can Be Configured With Right or Left Install

safe and Secure;This sliding bath transfer bench could be used for the elderly or disabled and offers integrated safety features including, rust resistant aluminum frame with blow molded seat with back rest, hook and loop safety belt, nylon strap locks hold seat in place, suction cup rubber anti slip feet, removable cut out for easy perineal access, and handle for extra stability while showering

EASY TO USE: Simply position one end of the transfer chair inside the shower and the other side outside. With the help of a caregiver, have the person carefully sit on the seat and gently slide them over the lip of the tub and into the shower
